Question: How to split json object extracted from mongodb using java: :Closed. This question does not meet Stack Overflow guidelines. Include attempted solutions, why they didn't work, and the expected results. See also: Stack Overflow question checklistClosed 9 years ago.                        Improve this question                    I have stored some JSON objects in MongoDB collections and using Mongo jar and Java I did full text search, and I am extracting one of my DB fields using below code:String tags2=dbo.getString("Tags");Result:[["pdf","java","c++"]["perl","pdf","c"]["java","c++"]]My requirement is to split all the words and remove duplicates. I require the following output:pdfjavac++cperlCan you please suggest a way to get this?
Please using this api: JsonElement.getAsString.
Answer: You can use the `JsonElement.getAsString` method to extract the JSON object from MongoDB and then use the `JsonParser` class to parse the JSON string. After that, you can use the `JsonArray` class to iterate over the JSON array and extract the individual JSON objects. Finally, you can use the `JsonArray.getAsJsonArray` method to get the JSON array from the JSON object and iterate over it to get the individual words. Here is a sample code snippet that demonstrates this:

```java
import com.google.gson.*;

// Assuming that dbo is your JsonObject
JsonObject dbo = ...; // your JsonObject

// Extract the JSON object from the "Tags" field
JsonElement tagsElement = dbo.get("Tags");

// Parse the JSON string to a JsonArray
JsonArray tagsArray = new JsonParser().parse(tagsElement.getAsString()).getAsJsonArray();

// Create a set to store the words
Set<String> words = new HashSet<>();

// Iterate over the JsonArray
for (JsonElement tagElement : tagsArray) {
    // Get the JsonArray from the JsonObject
    JsonArray tagArray = tagElement.getAsJsonArray();

    // Iterate over the JsonArray
    for (JsonElement wordElement : tagArray) {
        // Add the word to the set
        words.add(wordElement.getAsString());
    }
}

// Print the words
for (String word : words) {
    System.out.println(word);
}
```

This code will print the words "pdf", "java", "c++", "perl", "c", each on a new line.

Please note that this code assumes that the JSON objects in the "Tags" field are arrays of arrays, where each inner array contains the words for a specific tag. If the JSON structure is different, you will need to adjust the code accordingly.
